awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research: Conference: 2022 CISE Education and Workforce PI and Community Meetings
awd_abstract_narration:
CISE Education and Workforce (EWF) programs aim to create equitable and inclusive opportunities for computing education and develop a diverse workforce. STARS Computing Corps, a CISE Broadening Participation in Computing Alliance, will support two research community meetings: the CISE EWF Principal Investigator (PI) Meeting and the CISE Research Experiences for Undergraduates Site New PI Workshop.  Both convenings will provide opportunities for the principal investigators  of projects funded by CISE EWF programs to share their research outcomes, promising practices, and lessons learned.

Both the CISE EWF PI meeting and the REU Site New PI workshop will be large events for the Foundation and their respective community, bringing together PIs with representatives from government, academia, and non-profit. For each event, there is a pressing need to meticulously plan and organize agendas, venue and hybrid/remote conference logistics. This grant provides funding for the venue and logistics, including conference registration, audio visual, and meeting space for the hybrid CISE EWF PI meeting. It will also support the remote logistics of the CISE Research Experiences for Undergraduates Site New PI Workshop.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
This goal of this project was to support the community meetings and research publication venues for researchers and practitioners working on inclusive and equitable practices in computing education. Over 700 researchers, faculty, teachers, and practitioners attended the supported meetings from 2022-2023, and the project supported the publication of the RESPECT 2022 and 2023 proceedings in IEEE Xplore. 

The intellectual merit of this project lies in the publications and knowledge sharing that occurred at the RESPECT conference and the CISE EWF and REU Site meetings.

The broader impacts of this project lies in its opportunities for the principal investigators (PIs) of projects funded by CISE EWF programs to share their research outcomes, promising practices, and lessons learned through three community meetings: the co-located CISE EWF PI Meetings and RESPECT conferences in 2022 and 2023; as well as the CISE REU Site New PI Workshop in 2022. The CISE EWF PI Meeting hosted PIs from the NSF CISE EWF core programs on Broadening Participation in Computing (BPC), Computer Science for All (CSforAll: Research and RPPs), and Computing in Undergraduate Education (IUSE:CUE). The RESPECT conference, co-located with the CISE EWF PI Meeting in 2022 and 2023, provides a venue for research professional development and publications on how to best support students, especially those from underrepresented groups. The CISE REU Site New PI Workshop brought together PIs of newly funded CISE REU Site projects to connect them with experienced PIs within the REU Site community, who shared lessons learned on providing an effective research experience for undergraduate students, practical tips on the sometimes challenging logistics associated with organizing REU Site programs, and best practices and resources for broadening participation in computing through REU programs.

 


Last Modified: 06/05/2024
Modified by: Veronica M Catete
